card.name: A Day In The Life Of A Miskatonic University Student
card.text: Sometimes, University life can be exciting. Today is one of those days. This day takes you to THREE different MISCATONIC UNIVERSITY Locations. In your Speculative Civilizations course, you practice casting one SPELL with either Barrier, Circle, Sign or Chant in the card title. During Biology you dissect a MONSTER. Finally, you go on a field trip to a COUNTRY SITE where you attract an ALLY of the opposite sex as your Investigator.

card.name: Angles of Tagh Clatur
card.text: Summon or Control a Lesser Servitor.

card.name: Auction, The
card.text: Auctions are frequently good places to find extraordinary bargains for extraordinary items. Beginning in any CITY LOCATION located in Lovecraft Country, travel to THE AUCTION HOUSE in Vienna, Austria. Before the auction begins, find THIEVES IN THE ATTIC, and have a POLICE INVESTIGATION. Then, bid for an ARTIFACT or TOME that costs you TWO SANITY POINTS. Bring the item back to a second, different, CITY LOCATION in Lovecraft Country.

card.name: British Museum
card.text: Either your Investigator or an Ally must be a Professor, Student, or Scholar to play a Tome or Artifact while this is your current Location.

card.name: Capt. Edward Norrys
card.text: As long as he is chosen as a defending Ally, he raises the card value of all other Steadfast defending Allies by one point per card. Not cumulative with another Ally's Command Ability.

card.name: Capt. Karl Heinrich
card.text: As long as he is chosen as a defending Ally, he raises the card value of all other Steadfast defending Allies by 1 point per card. Not cumulative with another Ally's Command Ability.

card.name: Catacombs Beneath Paris, The
card.text: Rather than playing a Monster card from your hand, you may instead use this Gate to summon a Living Dead Monster or Ally from your Story Deck to your Threat.

card.name: Catacombs of Rome
card.text: Rather than playing a Monster card from your hand, you may instead use this Gate to summon a Living Dead Monster or Ally from your Story Deck to your Threat.

card.name: Closed-Cockpit Monoplane
card.text: Immediately play a new Location card in a different Region, right-side up on top of your Story Deck. May not play a Location within the same Region.

card.name: Congregational Church
card.text: You may remain here for one Turn and Bury one Phobia.

card.name: Dennys Barry
card.text: If you are using a female Investigator, Dennys must be chosen as a defending Ally in Combat, and add 2 points to the value of this card.

card.name: Dirigible
card.text: On a following turn, play any new Location card either in same Region or in a new Region, right-side up on top of your Story Deck.

card.name: Dominate
card.text: Use target Ally's Languages or card benefits one time, then flip Ally card.

card.name: Dr. Allen Halsey
card.text: The Doctor and one Ally of your choice are excluded when determining the results of an Epidemic.

attr.value: Steadfast M.U. Scholar & Doctor, Knows English & Latin

card.name: Dunwich Horror, The
card.text: Henry Armitage asks that you accompy him to Dunwich. Begin at MISCATONIC UNIVERSITY. TRAVEL BY LAND to 3 different DUNWICH LOCATIONS with HENRY ARMITAGE and ONE OTHER PROFESSOR. On SENTINEL HILL bring together LAVINIA WHATELEY, WILBUR WHATELEY, and the SON OF YOG-SOTHOTH during the FULL MOON. Find the NECRONOMICON and the VOOLA RITUAL spell, and then return the book to a second MISCATONIC UNIVERSITY Location.

card.name: Erich Zann
card.text: While this card is in play, subtract one from the Minimum number of cards that you may keep in your Hand. Not Cumulative with other Allies that lower your Minimum.

card.name: Eusapia Paladino
card.text: As a Turn, Bury this card to keep one Great Old One or Outer God in play for one additional round. Eusapia and one Ally of your choice are excluded when determining the results of an Epidemic.

card.name: Expedition, The
card.text: When you left this MISCATONIC UNIVERSITY Location with your TWO ALLIES, you dreamt only of the glory of exploration. What you found however, was a harrowing voyage of TRAVEL BY SEA, a STORM of surprising strength, the UNEXPECTED CALAMITY of a shipwreck, and the lost years in AMNESIA. Waking at a SITE, you discovered that weird old TOME - the only possession you salvaged when forced to flee from THREE MONSTERS.

attr.value: Steadfast M.U. Professor, Knows English, Latin, Greek, French & German

card.name: Herbert West
card.text: When played, choose an Ally Buried in your Story Deck and slip it beneath this card. Add their card values, and both function as one Ally card. This medical student and one Ally of your choice are excluded when determining the results of an Epidemic.

card.name: Huntingdon Asylum for Lunatics
card.text: Gain 5 Sanity points now, but you must spend next Turn i therapy (playing no cards, and not passing). You may remain here for one further Turn and Bury one Phobia.

card.name: Il Mondo Occulto
card.text: All Reporters add 1point to their card value when this card is your current Location.

card.name: Knight's Head inn
card.text: You may remain here for one Turn and Bury one Phobia.

card.name: La Mole Antonelliana
card.text: May use this Gate more than once, but you must bury one Spiritualist, Occultist, Musician, or Artist Ally for each additional use.

card.name: Lavinia Whateley
card.text: While this card is in play, add one to the Maximum number of cards that you may keep in your Hand. Cumulative with other Allies that raise your Maximum.

card.name: Lost in the Catacombs
card.text: Catacombs and other burial mounds have fascinated humankind for aeons. Growing up near the old Roman cities of Europe, you frequently sneak into those forbidden passages. In the CATACOMBS OF ROME or the CATACOMBS BENEATH PARIS you discover that Death is not always final, as a SKELETON, ZOMBIE, and MUMMY claw their way after you. Even if you flee to a nearby CHURCH, you dicover that their master, a VAMPIRE awaits. Only if you live until the DAWN OF A NEW DAY do you survive.

card.name: Madame Blavatsky
card.text: Discuss philosophy with her in any European Location for one Turn, and Bury one Phobia.

card.name: Mauretania
card.text: On a following turn, play a new Location card featuring the Water icon in a different Region, right-side up on top of your Story Deck. May not play a new Location in the same Region.

card.name: Miskatonic University Medical School
card.text: All Professors and Students add 1 point to their card value when this card is your current Location on your Story Deck.

card.name: Miskatonic University Memorial Hall
card.text: All Professors and Students add 1 point to their card value when this card is your current Location.

card.name: Miskatonic University Orne Library
card.text: All Professors and Students add 1 point to their card value when this card is your current Location on your Story Deck.

card.name: Miskatonic University Science Annex
card.text: All Professors and Students add 1 point to their card value when this card is your current Location.

attr.value: Steadfast M.U. Professor, Knows English, Glyphs & Atlantean

card.name: Necronomicon
card.text: Draw one additional card at the beginning of each Round while this card is in play. Not cumulative with other cards that allow you to increase hand size.

card.name: Necronomicon
card.text: Draw one additional card at the beginning of each Round while this card is in play. Not cumulative with other cards that allow you to increase hand size.

card.name: Necropolis, The
card.text: Rather than playing a Monster card from your hand, you may instead use this Gate to resurrect a Living Dead Monster or Ally from your Story Deck to your Threat.

card.name: Office of Dr. Freud, The
card.text: Each opponent reveals the top card of their Mythos Deck. If it is a Phobia, apply to you immediatly. Otherwise, Discard it. You may not bury Phobias here.

card.name: Old Man Whateley
card.text: Can know any one Spell. Bury Spell in your Story Deck after it is cast. As long as he is chosen as a defending Ally, he raises the card value of all other defending Whateleys by 1 point per card. Not cumulative with another Ally's Command Ability.

attr.value: Steadfast M.U. Professor, Knows English, Chinese & Latin

card.name: Remote Whateley Farmhouse
card.text: All Whateleys' add 1 point to their card value when this card is your current Location.

card.name: Secret of Power & Glory is Yours, The
card.text: If one is diligent and discovers the proper sources of knowledge, one can learn to master the universe. But you can only achieve your goal if you study and travel the world. Visit 5 different GATE LOCATIONS. Find a TOME of forbidden knowledge featuring the EYE ICON. Find an ALLY that costs you Sanity.

card.name: Son of Yog-Sothoth
card.text: Will always bypass Whateleys. Add 2 points to the value of this card when attacking an Investigator in Dunwich

card.name: Stonehenge
card.text: The stars are right! You may use this Gate more than once when Aldebaran Moves in the Sky or another Star is in play.

card.name: Titanic
card.text: On a following turn, play a new Location card featuring the Water attribute in a different Region, right-side up on top of your Story Deck. May not play a new Location in the same Region. Remain at sea for one turn and bury one Phobia card.

card.name: Typhoon
card.text: Bury Travel by Sea cards currently on top of any Story Deck, returning to former location. Ignore Sanity loss/gain, no Gate use. No Travel by Sea cards may be played while this card is in play. Bury this card if any Day or Night Event is played.

card.name: Unspeakable Oath, The
card.text: Procuring 'hard-to-find' goods for a select clientele is good business, but that MARSH fellow (any MARSH ALLY) sure is odd with that oath on that funny TOME and all. They must be building an army! Recently they've bought THREE WEAPONS shipments. My unease soon grew to PHOBIA proportions, but if I ever break that oath, I just know that I am doomed to CATASTROPHIC FAILURE and my wife and CHILDREN HAVE NIGHTMARES.

card.name: Wilbur Whateley
card.text: Use Wilbur to steal a Tome (cause it to be Buried) from your opponent, then Bury Wilbur.

card.name: Zachariah Whateley
card.text: While this card is in play, add one to the Maximum number of cards that you may keep in your Hand. Cumulative with other Allies that raise your Maximum.
